column4: Hi all!  Is there a linux tool for viewing windows event logs?
what file format are those in?
well there is a type of Windows file that can be opended on  Desktop Linux,  there's an article hmm,  I didn't read it properly yet though, so don't know if that's  what your after
(in fact I didn't even open the actsaul article up, just read a bit on the site where it was mentioned)
My vista is in a critical error loop.  Upon booting, it gives me an error message and reboots a minute later.  I need something to view the event logs to help diagnose the problem.
you can open .cfm files in Ubuntu, but I don't think that's what your after
are you getting the Blue Screen Of Death?
the movie companies have internal Linux software for making movies

well for Virtualbox some how not sure how maybe can find that one out in #vbox  for  VMware well theres VMware convert which can convert a pshyical Windows install into a virtual machine, but last time I tried it
it was the size of the partition :(
Thanks for the pointers.  I suppose I could do a partition resize before attempting a conversion.

and then if its XP, you can like set up a hardware profile first, and I guess other versons of Windows.  and then you got  a hardware profile for the pshyical install with its drivers and such,  and  then another for  the virtual machine once your running it as a vm.  I read some webpages and tried  VMware converter about a year or two ago or something.   Why not just do a clean install though of Windows, which is what I assume your
I have some software on the windows partition that I would like to keep, but for which I no longer have the installation media.
there is even a way to boot up a pshyicall install of Windows in virtual machine software, but I do not know the details
If it were not for that, I'd wipe and reinstall in a heartbeat.
